text: In a agile product expansion in banking where the project has high uncertainty and procurement options vary, what should the project manager do to recommend a project methodology or approach?

options.label: evaluate predictive, agile, or hybrid fit based on volatility and team readiness
mandate the same method used last year
choose a method based solely on tooling
switch methods midstream without reason

explanation: Option a is correct because method should fit context. Option b is incorrect because past approaches may not suit this project. Option c is incorrect because tools alone do not define methodology. Option d is incorrect because random switching disrupts delivery.

text: Given a outsourced infrastructure refresh in aviation where the project has high uncertainty and procurement options vary, which action best supports recommend a project methodology or approach?

options.label: ignore team capability when selecting a method
pilot or prove the approach before scaling
combine practices arbitrarily without integration
mandate the same method used last year

explanation: Option b is correct because experiments reduce adoption risk. Option a is incorrect because capability affects feasibility. Option c is incorrect because incoherent hybrids confuse the team. Option d is incorrect because past approaches may not suit this project.

text: While facing a incremental infrastructure refresh in pharma where stakeholder groups have competing goals and executives demand a clear approach, what is the most effective next step to recommend a project methodology or approach?

options.label: choose a method based solely on tooling
switch methods midstream without reason
align governance and controls to the chosen method
ignore team capability when selecting a method

explanation: Option c is correct because governance must match approach. Option a is incorrect because tools alone do not define methodology. Option b is incorrect because random switching disrupts delivery. Option d is incorrect because capability affects feasibility.
